text.div:
AlvearieFHIRImplementationGuide

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://alvearie.github.io/alvearie-fhir-ig/ImplementationGuide/alvearie.fhir.ig

Alvearie FHIR Profiles

resource.name: Alvearie Address
resource.description: Address wtih common extensions

resource.name: Communication Contact Point
resource.description: Contact point extended with country and phone ext for communications

resource.name: Alvearie ContactPoint
resource.description: ContactPoint with common extensions

resource.name: Alvearie Identifier
resource.description: Alvearie identifier with support for encrypted value

resource.name: Alvearie Organization
resource.description: Alvearie definition of what fields are needed for an organization

resource.name: Alvearie Patient
resource.description: The AlveariePatient resource contains the base information for the exchange of demographic and other data about a patient either receiving care or with the potential to receive care as known by a particular data source.  An AlveariePatient record is generally created and maintained by each organization with knowledge about the care provided for a patient. A unique patient may therefore have its information present in multiple AlveariePatient resource instances since multiple organizations are typically aware of and/or involved in a patient's care, including but not limited to provider organizations, payer organizations, and research organizations. The AlvearieMatchedPatient profile can be used in combination with this base profile to associate multiple instances of an AlveariePatient that are believed to potentially be about the same real world  individual.

resource.name: Data lineage meta with process extensions
resource.description: Metadata about a resource. The ProcessMeta StructureDefinition augments the base FHIR Meta profile with a set of extensions to support data lineage.

resource.name: Age Group Code
resource.description: Age Group Code

resource.name: Age Rollup Group Code
resource.description: Age Rollup Group Code

resource.name: Communication Care Gap
resource.description: ID of care gap for which we are communicating

resource.name: Communication Contact
resource.description: Phone number, email, or address to contact

resource.name: Communication Language
resource.description: Language used for communication messaging content

resource.name: Communication Measure
resource.description: Reference to the measure that resulted in the communication

resource.name: Communication Mode
resource.description: Mode of communication (phone | sms | email | mail | chat)

resource.name: Communication On-Behalf Of
resource.description: Attributed provider, location, or organization communication is on-behalf of

resource.name: Communication Opt-Out
resource.description: Opt-out details for communication with an individual

resource.name: Communication Outcome
resource.description: Vendor-specific communication response code or text

resource.name: Communication Payload Data
resource.description: Contains dynamic data elements and vendor / medium specific elements to be included in the message payload

resource.name: Communication Priority Sequence
resource.description: Priority of the communication request (1 = highest)

resource.name: Communication Product
resource.description: Product generating the communication

resource.name: Communication Reengagement
resource.description: Sequence for subsequent communication attempts to reengage the patient

resource.name: Communication Retry Limit
resource.description: Retry limit configuration, may vary by medium and vendor

resource.name: Communication Sent Time
resource.description: Time communication was attempted

resource.name: Communication Template
resource.description: Id or url reference to template to be used for communication

resource.name: Communication Vendor
resource.description: Vendor used to send the communication

resource.name: Conversation Type
resource.description: Type of conversation, used for ihe chat communications

resource.name: County Code
resource.description: Administrative division of a country or state

resource.name: Documented Sex
resource.description: Sex coding indicated on the legal document

resource.name: Documented Source
resource.description: Source type of the legal document

resource.name: Documented System
resource.description: Source system or jurisdiction of the legal document

resource.name: Effective Period
resource.description: Effective period

resource.name: Encrypted State
resource.description: Encrypted state

resource.name: Family Id
resource.description: The unique identifier for the subscriber (contract holder, employee) and the associated dependents.

resource.name: Identified Pronouns
resource.description: Gender, typically described in terms of masculinity and femininity, is a social construction that varies across different cultures and over time.  This value is often used for identity purposes and should be collected directly from the patient.

resource.name: Ingestion Batch Id
resource.description: Generated by an ingestion service management API, the ingestion-batch-id represents a collection/grouping of messages that the producer submitted together.  The 'batch' definition needs to be agreed upon by data producers and data consumers.

resource.name: Language Rank
resource.description: Specify preferred order of language use (1 = highest).

resource.name: Legally Documented Sex
resource.description: Sex as defined or amended on the patient's legal documentation, for example a birth certificate or driver's license.

resource.name: Process Name
resource.description: The name of the process or service that has produced the data held in the FHIR resource or element.

resource.name: Process Organization
resource.description: The organizing entity that owns the process that has produced the data held in the FHIR resource or element.

resource.name: Process Record ID
resource.description: The record id that the data producer or data integrator uses internally to identify this data.

resource.name: Process Timestamp
resource.description: The timestamp the data was generated within this FHIR resource or element.

resource.name: Process Type
resource.description: The classification type of the process that has produced the data held in the FHIR resource or element. For example, if the process is primarily a Natural Language Processing (NLP) service, the type may be specified as NLP. Or if the process is primarily one that aggregates and groups related items, the type may be specified as Grouper.

resource.name: Process Version
resource.description: The version of the process or service that has produced the data held in the FHIR resource or element.

resource.name: Reengagement Display
resource.description: Communication reengagement sequence display text

resource.name: ReengagementValue
resource.description: Communication reengagement sequence value

resource.name: Region Code
resource.description: Administrative area or division with definable characteristics

resource.name: Sent To recipient
resource.description: Records date/time and outcome of communication attempts with the recipient

resource.name: Sent To Vendor
resource.description: Records date/time and outcome of communications sent to vendor

resource.name: Sex Assigned At Birth
resource.description: Sex assigned at birth based on observation by a physician.  Also called phenotype, or how the genes were expressed, based on the observation of the doctor. This assignment may not match the gender Identity of the person, which will not be known until the newborn is older.

resource.name: SexualOrientation
resource.description: Patient's physical, romantic, and/or emotional attraction towards other people.

resource.name: Source Data Model Version
resource.description: The version of the data model in the source system used by the data producer or data integrator.

resource.name: Source File ID
resource.description: The identifier for a file that the data producer or data integrator extracted knowledge from to produce the data within this FHIR resource or element.

resource.name: Stated Reason
resource.description: Recorded reason specified by the recipient

resource.name: Status Code
resource.description: Client-specific patient status codes.

resource.name: Tenant Id
resource.description: Defined by metadata and provided by the data producer, the ID that the messages will be stored at and processed as within the data pipeline.

resource.name: Engagement Communication Mode Value Set
resource.description: Communication modes supported for Engagement communication

resource.name: Engagement Context Value Set
resource.description: Context for an engagement action

resource.name: Engagement Conversation Type Value Set
resource.description: Codes indicating types for Engagement communications

resource.name: Gender Identity Value Set
resource.description: Gender identity codes typically described in terms of masculinity and femininity, is a social construction that varies across different cultures and over time.  This value is often used for identity purposes and should be collected directly from the patient.

resource.name: Identifier Type Value Set
resource.description: Extended set of identifier type codes from FHIR HL7 and extended Alvearie resource identifiers

resource.name: Legal Document Source Value Set
resource.description: Codes indicating the source of legal document used for identification

resource.name: Legal Document System Value Set
resource.description: Codes indicating the system of legal document used for identification

resource.name: Opt-Out Reason Value Set
resource.description: Codes indicating reasons patients may specify for opting-out of communications

resource.name: Patient Importance Value Set
resource.description: Patient importance status codes used to trigger or limit patient operations

resource.name: Patient Status Value Set
resource.description: Examples of client-specified patient status codes

resource.name: Sex Assigned At Birth Value Set
resource.description: Value set for sex assigned at birth based on observation by a physician. Also called phenotype, or how the genes were expressed, based on the observation of the doctor. This assignment may not match the gender Identity of the person, which will not be known until the newborn is older.

resource.name: Sexual Orientation Value Set
resource.description: Codes indicating a person's physical, romantic, and/or emotional attraction towards other people

resource.name: Engagement Communication Mode Codes
resource.description: Communication modes supported for Engagement communication

resource.name: Engagement Context Codes
resource.description: Context for an engagement action

resource.name: Engagement Conversation Type Codes
resource.description: Codes indicating conversation types for Engagement communications

resource.name: Gender Identity Codes
resource.description: Gender identity codes typically described in terms of masculinity and femininity, is a social construction that varies across different cultures and over time.  This value is often used for identity purposes and should be collected directly from the patient.

resource.name: Identifier Type Codes
resource.description: Extended set of Identifier type code for Alvearie resources

resource.name: Legal Document Source Codes
resource.description: Codes indicating the source of legal document used for identification

resource.name: Legal Document System Codes
resource.description: Codes indicating the system of legal document used for identification

resource.name: Opt-Out Reason Codes
resource.description: Codes indicating reasons patients may specify for opting-out of communications

resource.name: Patient Importance Codes
resource.description: Patient status code examples

resource.name: Patient Status Codes
resource.description: Patient status code examples

resource.name: Primary or Secondary
resource.description: Identifies the origin of the data elements from primary or secondary systems.

resource.name: Sex Assigned At Birth Codes
resource.description: Value set for sex assigned at birth based on observation by a physician. Also called phenotype, or how the genes were expressed, based on the observation of the doctor. This assignment may not match the gender Identity of the person, which will not be known until the newborn is older.

resource.name: Sexual Orientation Codes
resource.description: Codes indicating a person's physical, romantic, and/or emotional attraction towards other people

resource.name: Alvearie Organization - General Hospital
resource.description: Sample Alvearie Organization representing a hospital ingested from a EMR or PMS system
